channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report E-2024050313
item.description:
Report E-2024050313

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-17T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-08
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 8, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of cleaning compound was punctured in transit and released approximately 55-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group (TPM) to remediate the impacted site. TPM personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum of product was placed into one (1) 95-gallon drum.
